FARMER FAMILY PROFILE SOCIOECONOMIC PROFILE FARMING ECONOMIC PROFILE PRODUCTIVE PROFILE PLOT INFORMATION ADOPTION OBSERVATIONS ADOPTION OBSERVATION RESULTS ADDITIONAL INTERVENTION
1. Farmer name: 2. Farmer or farm code: 3. Date of birth (year):> 4. Gender: 5. Educational level: 6. Village: 7.House location: Get location 8. Postal address: 9. Phone number: 10. Year started working with or selling to the company: 11. Spouse: C1. Number of spouses: C2. Spouse name: C3. Spouse date of birth (year): C4. Spouse educational level: 12. Total number of children: C5. Children between 5 to 17 years old: C6. Children between 5 to 17 years old enrolled in school: 13. Number of household members including the farmer: 14. Farmer group Click to take a family photo 15. How many household members (excluding the farmer) work on the farm without paid wages? 16. How many household members (including the farmer) depend on the total household income? 17. Does any member of the household earn income for other work? C7. Apart from farming cocoa and other crops, how much income does the farmer earn from other sources in a year? C8. Apart from farming cocoa and other crops, does the spouse earn income from other sources? C9. How much income does the spouse earn from other sources in a year? 18. Does the other household members contribute to the household income? C10. How much income does the other household members contribute in a year? 19. Does the household have a loan that needs to be paid back? C11. How much do you still have to pay back? C12. Where did you get the loan? C13. How often do you pay back? C14. How much do you pay back per payment? 20. Has the household given a loan? C15. How much does the lender have to pay back? C16. How much do they pay back? 21. Household savings: 22. How much does the household spend on food, utilities, housing, and transit in a year? 23. How much does the household spend on other expenses (excluding education) in a year? 24. Does the household have any planned investments? If so, how much have they allocated for the investment? 25. How much will the household spend on education next year? (school fees, books, uniforms, payment for dormitory etc.) 26. Does the farmer have a bank account? C17. Account type C18. Does the farmer account have a mobile money option? C19. Want a bank account? 27. Units of measure Area Weight *bag = 60kg bag 28. What is your total kg production of dry cocoa beans in a crop year or calendar year? 29. What is the average farm gate dry bean cocoa price per kg for last year? 30. How much did you spend on cocoa farm INPUTS in the past year i.e. fertilizer, pesticides etc. (year means past two seasons, mid and main crop)? 31. How much income did you earn from cocoa in the past year (year means past two seasons, mid and main crop)? 32. Do you have additional crops? C20. How much income did you earn from other crops in the past year? (year means past two seasons, mid and main crop) C21. Additional crops: Click to take a photo of the farm map 33. Year of farm establishment (first time something was planted) 34. Farm certifications: 35. Total land ownership or availability size 36. Total land under cultivation size 37. Total land under cocoa size 38. Total cocoa planting already under renovation size
39. Number of plots:
40. Plot GPS: 41. Plot size 42. Estimated production size in 43. Soil PH: 44. Planting material: 45. Tree density: 46. Tree age: 47. Tree health: 48. Debilitating disease (CSSV): 49. Pruning: 50. Pest and disease and sanitation: 51. Weeding: 52. Harvesting: 53. Shade management: 54. Soil condition: 55. Organic matter: 56. Fertilizer formulation: 57. Fertilizer application: 58. Lime need: 59. Drainage need: 60. Filling in or thinning out option: 61. Hire labor: Genetics of plant material: Farm condition: GAPS: Soil fertility management: Calculate

Plot Income: Cost of Maintenance / Investment: Labor needed in man days: Cost of labor: Plot P&L: Change for Replanting
Net income from Cocoa: Net income from Other Crops: Total farming income: Net income from all other sources: Total income: Total family expenses: Net family income: Investment in FDP: Profit or Loss Agreed on recommendations: Comments: Maintenance (GAPS) Graft Replant Extra Soil Management Lime Drainage Filling in Thinning Out Labor January February March April May June July August September October November December Farmer Name and Farmer Code cannot be empty or Number of Plots need to be higher than 0 ! Your plots area can not be higher than Cocoa Area on farm, fix it before continue Your renovation area can not be higher than you Cocoa Area Your areas present inconsistencies fix it before continuing Save successful! Autosaved Clearing Drainage Lining for coca and shade Cocoa Planting Cocoa re- or inter-planting Temporary shade Shade Planting Pruning/Sanitation Fertilizer Grafting work/ remove plastic Pollarding/Sanitation Weeding Circle weeding Fertilizer Lime P and D Control Maint pruning Shape pruning Maintenance Reducing mother trees branches Sanitation Shape pruning Shade replanting Harvest This includes paid labor on other farms, nursery, other business or services that bring in money into the farmer household This includes paid labor on other farms, sales from other business or services for other people that bring in money into the household This includes all money that is available to family excluding that from farmer and spouse. Money can be from brothers, sisters, parents or other family members who can be living in home or sending from other village, city or country Conversion ratio for Wet to Dry is 100:35 or 35% This is educational expense post secondary schooling and/or beyond normal schooling expense Farm expenses include all expenses incurred in the production, fermentation, storage and sale of cocoa. Please account for all inputs, labor payments etc Your estimated production is greater than that of the previous year Your estimated production is less than that of the previous year Your plots area cannot be higher than Cocoa Area on farm Your plots area cannot be empty Your areas cannot be higher than your Total Land Ownership Area Children between 5 and 17 or children enrolled in school cannot be higher than Total number of children The number of family members can not be less than the number of children Household Savings Planned investments Reason for renovation: How long ago was made renovation? Your plot renovated size cannot be higher than your under renovation size (Ac): (Ha): (Kg): (Bag): (Qq): Was this plot recently renovated?
